oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Kris Kristofferson and Don Was - 1995-06-13
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Kris Kristofferson and Don Was made for the promotion of the album A Moment of Forever. Likely audio for a promotional video made for/by Justice Records from June 13, 1995. Labeled as original master. Unidentified interviewers with questions off-mic.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kris Kristofferson; Don Was;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Don Was with answer to question about his motivation to work with Kris / (01:30) The studio musicians reaction to being called to work on Kris' album / (02:45) Kris with what Don pulled from him for the album and adding extra verses to five songs / (04:35) Why Don suggested extra verses / (06:14) Kris comments about why there are numerous love songs on this album and where he was personally during the recording (07:23) The recording of the song The Moment Of Forever / (08:11) Don with comments on the album and the song The Moment Of Forever / (08:50) The story behind the song Johnny Lobo / (11:01) The story behind the song The Promise / (11:59) Re-recording Casey's Last Ride / (13:00) Don with thoughts of adding nuance's to older songs / (13:55) Does Kris think of himself as an influence on today's songs and songwriters / (14:52) Don with his thoughts on Kris as an influence / (17:20) Kris with his thoughts on Bob Dylan and his influence on country music /

(17:50) Don talks about Kris not being a country or Nashville artist / (19:37) Kris with his thoughts on John Prine / (20:45) Kris with his thoughts on the Americana music genre and more on John Prine / (21:55) Kris asked his definition of Americana music / (22:50) Kris with his sense of what's good about Americana music and music in general / (25:15) Kris with more thoughts about his music / (26:10) Don comments on his sense of the history of pop music / (29:14) Question to Don about MCA Records, pulling American Records from the MCA imprint and the impact of radio stations on the record business / (33:20) Kris comments on not ever changing his style to fit popular styles / (33:50) Kris comments on starting at at the bottom and learning the song publishing business / (35:29) Why Don brought the album to Justice Records / (37:05) Kris' thoughts on this album being on Justice Records / (39:15) Kris talks about his upcoming film Lone Star and filming in Texas /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Kristofferson, Kris; Was, Don; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
